info.name: Thalamus, ventral posterior nucleus
info.description: The ventral posterior thalamic nucleus (VP) has two subdivisions that deal with somatosensory information from the body (VPL) and head (VPM). Afferents arrive via the medial lemniscus, spinothalamic and trigeminothalamic tracts. This nucleus sends efferents to post-central gyrus of cerebral cortex via the posterior limb of the internal capsule.
